ARABIC: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن سُلَٰلَةٍ مِّن طِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We created man from the purest kind of clay;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We created man from the finest extract of clay,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We created man out of the extract of clay,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have created the human being from an extract of clay
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed We created man from a chosen soil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And indeed We created man out of an extract of Tin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And certainly We created man of an extract of clay,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We created man of an extraction of clay,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Verily We created man from a product of wet earth;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We created man from an essence of clay,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And assuredly We created man of an extract of clay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Certainly We created man from an extract of clay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Man We did create from a quintessence (of clay);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And indeed We created man (Adam) out of an extract of clay (water and earth).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We created the human from an essence of clay:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We created man from an extract of clay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:12] And, by God, We certainly created man, Adam, from an extraction (min sulālatin, derives from [the verbal expression] salaltu’l-shay’a mina’l-shay’, ‘I drew one thing out of another’, meaning, ‘I extracted it therefrom’) his [Adam’s] substance being, of clay (min tīnin is semantically connected to sulālatin, ‘an extraction’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Verily We created man) the son of Adam (from a product of wet earth);
